definition: lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom)/fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
rib/Taiwan pr. [le4]
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
old variant of 插[cha1]
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao

sentences.english: I put my ass on the line for you. I know you'll do the same for me someday.
sentences.chinese: 我为你两肋插刀，我知道有朝一日你也会为我这么做。

sentences.english: Bob's like a blood brother and would do anything for me.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃象亲兄弟，愿意为我两肋插刀。

sentences.english: He is especially loyal to his friends, and willing to do anything to help them.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人特讲义气，甘愿为朋友两肋插刀。

sentences.english: Don't mention it, anything for you.

definition: spirit of loyalty and self-sacrifice/code of brotherhood/also pr. [yi4 qi5]
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
supremely honorable and righteous
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to be totally devoted (to a person)
(coll.) to be a true friend
affectionate and true/loyal (idiom)
affection/comradeship
paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
lit. drinking buddy (idiom)/fig. fair-weather friend
not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
